name: @brickblock/smart-contracts
description: Smart contracts for the Brickblock platform
author: Brickblock Dev Team <dev@brickblock.io>

scripts.start: concurrently --prefix '[{name}: {time}]' -n 'yarn start:dev, seed' -c 'bgBlue.bold.white,bgGreen.bold.white' 'yarn start:dev' 'yarn migrate:dev && yarn seed'
scripts.---SECTION:BUILD---: -------------------- HOW TO BUILD THE SMART CONTRACTS --------------------
scripts.build:comment: Compile smart contracts and output into the build/ dir
scripts.build:inject-deployed-contracts:comment: making the deployed chainid:address pair as configured in .env available to build/contract/Brickblock.json
scripts.clean:comment: Clean up old contracts and build files
scripts.clean:install:comment: In case there are some dependency issues, a clean install often helps
scripts.---SECTION:MIGRATE---: -------------------- HOW TO MIGRATE AND SYNC THE SMART CONTRACTS --------------------
scripts.migrate:comment: Compile smart contracts and output into the build/ dir then deploys our smart contracts to the some network
scripts.test:ci:comment: Why the magic for getting a port? Creating a local file based on the session-id seems to be the easiest way to share state (namely the current ganache port) between multiple npm script tasks
scripts.test:ci: port=$(./scripts/get-ganache-port.sh); start-test test:ci:start-ganache tcp:"$port" test:ci:start-tests && rm "GANACHE_PORT_TERM_ID_${XDG_SESSION_ID:-$TERM_SESSION_ID}"
scripts.test:ci:start-tests: port=$(./scripts/get-ganache-port.sh); truffle test test/main-tests/* test/main-tests/poaToken/* --network ci"$port"
scripts.test:ci:poa-proxy: port=$(./scripts/get-ganache-port.sh); start-test test:ci:start-ganache tcp:"$port" test:ci:poa-proxy:start-tests && rm "GANACHE_PORT_TERM_ID_${XDG_SESSION_ID:-$TERM_SESSION_ID}"
scripts.test:coverage:comment: Because solidity-coverage is still experimental we won't fail CI if it fails for now
scripts.test:mythril:comment: ConsenSys' security vulnerability scanner for smart contracts
scripts.release:comment: This script should only ever be automatically run by our CI. Manual releases are error-prone and can mess up version history
scripts.precommit:comment: Makes sure we don't commit bad code
scripts.prepush:comment: Run healthcheck on prepush to ensure no bad code makes it to GitLab
scripts.postmerge:comment: Automatically run 'yarn install' on postmerge if `yarn.lock` changed
scripts.---SECTION:HOUSEKEEPING---: -------------------- GITHOOKS, HEALTHCHECK, OPEN TODOS, VULNERABILITY CHECK etc. --------------------
scripts.health:comment: Runs all checks (linters, tests etc) to gauge the overall code health
scripts.todo:comment: Prints out all code comments that begin with `TODO:` or `FIXME:`
scripts.---SECTION:REPL---: --- INTERACT WITH DEPLOYED CONTRACTS IN A LOCAL REPL ---
scripts.repl:comment: Useful for quickly interacting with deployed contracts, likely through an INFURA node
scripts.---SECTION:DIAGRAMS---: --- GENERATE IMAGE ASSETS FOR SMART CONTRACT ECOSYSTEM DIAGRAMS ---
scripts.diagram:render:comment: using the mermaid.cli tool -> there is an online editor here https://mermaidjs.github.io/mermaid-live-editor
